justification: The article states that "Moral judgments are not one unitary response but consist of at least four kinds: evaluations (good vs. bad)…" indicating that evaluations are a way the construct is assessed.
In listing facets of moral judgment, the authors include "norm judgments (e.g., permissible, forbidden)," showing this facet is used to measure the broader construct.
The same sentence notes that moral judgment includes "wrongness judgments," identifying this as another measurement facet for the construct.
The authors add "blame judgments" to the list of facets, indicating blame assessments are employed to measure moral judgment.

The article explains that trust in robots is "multidimensional, diverging into at least a performance dimension and a relational-moral dimension," implying performance trust is one metric of the trust construct.
The same sentence names a "relational-moral dimension" of trust, indicating moral trust serves as another measure of the overall trust construct.
